mg.mapviewer

Class ControlView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • mg.mapviewer.ControlView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class ControlView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
    The control view is the parent container view object. So it is the parent for
    • the dashboard
    • all menu und submenu buttons
    • the transparency control sliders
    • the progress bar
    • the status line
    • the quick controls
    See Also:
    MGMapActivity_ViewModel

      private class  ControlView.ZoomOCL
      This OnClickListener is used for all dashboard entry fields and also for all status line views.

      • dashboardKeys

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> dashboardKeys
        There are five dashboard entries, each with a specific semantic. This ordered list contains the viewIds of these five entries.

      • dashboardMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,android.view.ViewGroup> dashboardMap
        Mapping of the viewIDs to the Dashboard entries. The Dashboard entry objects are kept here even if they are not visible.

      • controlMap

        java.util.Map<Control,android.view.View> controlMap
        A Control object is an extension of a ViewOnClickListener. With this map it's easy to determine from the OnClickListener the corresponding View object. Furthermore this map provides a list of all menu and submenu views.
